III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
Description suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation About two weeks ago, prior to a youth's visit with their mother, the
youth's foster care worker hit him in the face and arm and also bit
him. The youth had a red mark on the face at the visit. On
11/27/24, after a visit with their mother, the youth and siblings did
not want to return with the foster care worker. The foster care
worker threatened to call law enforcement on the respondent
mother.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Youth A was interviewed in person on 12/3/2024 at the school he
attends. Also present was MDHHS Worker and School Social
Worker. Youth A reported the last time he visited with his mom,
Parent A, they played outside and climbed a tree at home. Youth
A stated Foster Care Worker brings him to visits with Parent A. He
described Foster Care Worker as nice and stated she is never
mean. He stated he will watch a movie or tv shows when he is in
her car. When asked, Youth A responded Foster Care Worker has
never hurt him.
School Social Worker was interviewed in person on 12/4/2024 at
the school Youth A and Youth B attend. Also present was MDHHS
Worker. School Social Worker reported knowing the youth well.
She stated she had no concerns for their well-being and feels their
needs are being met by their caregivers and foster care agency.
She stated she has only met Foster Care Worker during meetings
but has had no concerns with her.
Youth B was interviewed in person on 12/3/2024 at the school he
attends. Also present was MDHHS Worker and School Social
Worker. Youth B reported living with Foster Parent 2. He stated
the last visit with Parent A was at a playground when it was
snowing. He stated Foster Care Worker brought him to the visit.
Youth B then stated, “we went and told the judge she hit my
brother.” When asked how he knew Foster Care Worker hit his
brother, he stated he saw it. He went on to state that Foster Care
Worker smacked Youth A on his cheek, but Youth A did not cry.
2

Youth B stated this happened while Youth B was in the front seat
of Foster Care Worker’s car. He stated Foster Care Worker
reached out her arm and smacked Youth A’s face “on super
purpose.” He then stated Foster Care Worker said curse words.
He stated he does not know why Foster Care Worker hit his
brother, but he was hit 101 times. He then added Foster Care
Worker pinched Youth A’s neck while they were parked by the
library. He reported this all took place before a visit at the library.
He added Foster Care Worker also bit Youth A on the arm. He
stated Foster Care Worker is not safe and is a “bad girl” for hitting,
biting and pinching Youth A. Youth B was asked if anything like
this has happened before and he said Youth A has been hit by
Foster Care Worker 101 times on “different kind of days.” When
Youth B was asked when and why he told the Judge about Foster
Care Worker hitting Youth A, he replied he did not know. He then
began talking about driving in an invisible car. He was asked when
the last time he saw a police officer was, to which he responded it
was a long time ago in a “super invisible car” and that he hates the
police officer and cut off his head, arms and legs because the
police officer tried to fight Youth B. When Youth B was redirected
to a discussion of the visit in question, he stated he did not
remember anything else about the visit other than the visit was
with his mom and dad.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 12/3/2024.
MDHHS Worker was present with Foster Care Worker at a local
MDHHS office. Foster Care Worker reported she transported
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C to a parenting time visit the
previous Wednesday. She stated she has been transporting the
youths to visits for approximately two years. She stated parenting
time with Parent A has been unsupervised since March and
Foster Care Worker provided transportation to and from these
visits 2-3 times per month. She stated the prosecutor on the case
asked that visits be suspended in July, but the judge did not
agree. She reported the current goal for the case is termination of
parental rights.
She stated Youth A typically sits in the middle row on the
passenger side of her vehicle and Youth B sits in the back row
during transports to and from visits. She stated the youths never
sit in the front seat. She denied ever hitting, pinching, or biting
Youth A or any of the youths. She stated she has minimal physical
contact with the youths and Youth A in particular as he is sensitive
to touch. She reported she even asks him to buckle himself in and
out of her vehicle to limit physical touch.
3

On 11/27/2024, she drove the youths from the Grand Rapids area
to the library in Benton Harbor. When Parent A arrived, she stated
her father, Grandparent A, was in town and wanted to take the
youths out to lunch. Foster Care Worker stated she noticed the
youths’ paternal grandmother, Grandparent B, was with Parent A,
not Parent A’s father. She stated she is unsure why Parent A
would lie about this as the Grandparent B is allowed at visits. The
visit was supposed to end at 2:00pm so Foster Care Worker
returned to the library at approximately 1:45pm at which time she
texted Parent A to remind her to have the youths use the
bathroom before returning to Foster Care Worker. At
approximately 2:15pm, Parent A texted Foster Care Worker
stating she was at a gas station and Youth A was using the
bathroom. Foster Care Worker texted Parent A at approximately
2:30pm as they had not yet arrived, to which Parent A responded
with a text that Grandparent A had gotten pulled over and they
were with the police. Foster Care Worker responded to Parent A
that she knew they were with Grandparent B and not Grandparent
A. At approximately 2:45pm Parent A texted Foster Care Worker
stating Youth A had just told the police Foster Care Worker had hit
him. At this same time, Officer 1 called and left a message for
Foster Care Worker stating Youth A had told them his foster
mother hit him. Foster Care Worker returned the call to Officer 1
who reported having told Parent A to return the kids to Foster
Care Worker and advised Foster Care Worker to call dispatch if
they were not returned.
Foster Care Worker stated she received multiple texts from Parent
A requesting someone other than Foster Care Worker pick up the
youths to which Foster Care Worker did not respond. Foster Care
Worker called dispatch, and officers went out to Parent A’s home.
Parent A was not there, but the youths’ father was and gave the
officers a number to reach Grandparent B. The officers called the
number and told the paternal grandmother to bring the youth to
the police department. Once the youths were brought to the police
department, they were brought to Foster Care Worker at the
library. Foster Care Worker then drove the youths back to their
foster homes. During the drive, Youth B told her that his
grandmother does not like Foster Care Worker and that she
shouldn’t be around the youths after which Youth A told Foster
Care Worker, “you are not a bad person.” The youths told Foster
Care Worker they went to their Grandparent B’s house then the
police department. As she was dropping the youths off, Foster
Care Worker received a call from Program Manager who
requested she bring the youths to the agency office. Foster Care
4

Worker stated she has had no contact with the youths since that
day.
An attempt to interview Youth C was made on 12/3/2024 by
phone while MDHHS Worker was present at the daycare center
she attends; however, Youth C refused to speak.
Daycare Lead Teacher was interviewed by phone while MDHHS
Worker was present at the daycare center. She reported Youth C
has been going to the daycare center 2 days a week for 6-7
weeks with the exception of one week during which Youth C was
with an alternate care provider. Daycare Lead Teacher stated she
has had no concerns with the care of Youth C. She has not
observed any bruises or marks. She stated she had met Foster
Care Worker and has had no concerns with her. She stated Youth
C is happy to go with Foster Care Worker for visits.
Parent A was interviewed by phone on 12/29/2024 along with
MDHHS Worker. MDHHS Worker had previously interviewed
Parent A and she stated everything she reported during that
interview was accurate. She stated Youth A told Parent A that
Foster Care Worker abused him. She stated she had a recording
of him saying that on 11/20 and 11/27 of 2024 and she would
provide the recording to MDHHS Worker. She stated there was a
court hearing yesterday and the Judge set a hearing to deliver his
ruling regarding termination of parental rights on 1/2/25. She
stated her parenting time is currently supervised at a local
MDHHS office. Parent A reported the following to MDHHS
Worker:
o A few weeks ago, during an unsupervised parenting
visit on a Thursday, Youth B told her that Foster
Care Worker turned around and smacked him on the
face while they were in Foster Care Worker’s vehicle
on the way to the visit. He also stated Foster Care
Worker bit him on the arm and smacked him on the
hand.
o She saw a small red mark on Youth A’s face, but
she believed it was from him leaning on his arm.
o Her children bite each other and leave marks.
o She did not tell anyone about Youth A’s allegations
and “let it go.”
o During the unsupervised parenting visit on
11/27/2024, she asked Youth A about Foster Care
Worker hitting him because she and her boyfriend
decided to do so the day prior.
5

o Youth A responded that Foster Care Worker is mean
and a jerk to him.
o Grandparent A met them at Golden Corral for dinner
during the 11/27/2024 visit.
o During dinner, Grandparent A told her she needed to
“take care of this” regarding the allegations made by
Youth A against Foster Care Worker.
o She asked Youth B if Youth A was lying to her and
Youth B stated he was not.
o She feels her children lie sometimes because they
want to return home.
o She and Grandparent A were pulled over during the
11/27/2024 visit for failure to use a turn signal.
o The officer who pulled them over did not ask for
Grandparent A’s ID or paperwork, just told him to
use his turn signal next time.
o After dinner, she and Grandparent B drove with the
youths to the foster care agency to talk to someone
about the allegations, but no one was there.
o When back in Benton Harbor, she and Grandparent
B called dispatch and Officer 1 arrived to talk with
them.
o Officer 1 took a report and left without talking to
Youth A.
o She and Grandparent B decided to drive the youths
to the Grand Rapids police department and have the
foster parents pick them up there.
o Benton Harbor police department called her and told
her to return the children to Foster Care Worker.
o The youths did not want to go with Foster Care
Worker.
o She met Officer 2 at the Benton Harbor police
station and told Officer 2 what Youth A had reported.
o Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C went into the police
station with Officer 2.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed by video conferencing
on 1/7/2025. She stated she has been supervising Foster Care
Worker since June of 2022. She stated she has no concerns with
Foster Care Worker’s job performance or interaction with youths
on her caseload. Foster Care Supervisor stated she has received
good feedback from families with whom Foster Care Worker has
worked. During the parental termination hearing for Parent A, the
Judge made a point of stating how unique it is that one worker has
been assigned throughout the life of a case and that the parents
only began complaining about her once the goal became
6

termination. Foster Care Supervisor stated she has heard Youth A
speak highly of Foster Care Worker. She has not heard anything
directly from Youth B regarding any concerns with Foster Care
Worker.
Foster Care Program Manager was interviewed by video
conferencing. She reported during the two and a half years Foster
Care Worker has been with the agency there have been no
performance concerns. She described Foster Care Worker as
calm and even tempered with youths. She stated she has no
concerns with Foster Care Worker being around Youth A or any
youths.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• Email received from MDHHS Worker with notes from his
interview with the nurse who saw Youth A on 12/5/2024.
The notes indicated no marks, bruises, or injuries were
observed and Youth A reported no one has bit, smacked,
or pinched him.
• Benton Harbor Department of Public Safety report
completed by Officer 1 documenting a report of possible
assault and battery was made 11/27/2024 at 1:50pm.
Officer 1 met with Parent A, Grandparent B, Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C at the MDHHS office in Benton Harbor. The
following is documented in the report:
o Parent A reported Youth told her his foster mother
hit him in the face and arm.
o Officer 1 left a voicemail for Foster Care Worker.
o Foster Care Worker called back and was told of the
allegations.
o Foster Care Worker reported this is the fourth or fifth
time Parent A has alleged someone has assaulted
her children after her visits.
o Parent A told Foster Care Worker she was not
bringing the children back to her.
• Benton Harbor Department of Public Safety report
completed by Officer 2 documenting a report of parental
kidnapping made 11/27/2024 at 2:52pm. Officer 2 met with
Foster Care Worker at the Benton Harbor library. The
following is documented in the report:
o Officer 2 made phone contact with Grandparent B
who stated they were enroute to Kent County to
speak with a sheriff about getting a new caseworker
o Officer 2 noted the sheriff has no authority to assign
7

a caseworker and believed this was made up
o Officer 1 told Grandparent B she needed to turn the
children over to him as soon as possible.
o Officer 2 spoke with Parent A by phone while she
was in the car with Grandparent B and Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C
o Parent A stated she knew an officer in Kent County
who could help her
o Parent A did not want to return the children to Foster
Care Worker because she would bring them back to
Foster Parent 1 who allegedly hit Youth A three
weeks ago.
o Grandparent B never arrived at the police station;
however, Parent A turned the children over to Officer
2 at the Bernton Harbor Police Department.
o Youth A and Youth C were in car seats when they
arrived at the police station, but Youth B was not.
o No marks were observed on the youths, and they
were in good spirits.
o Officer 2 noted no allegations were made against
Foster Care Worker.
o Officer 2 turned the children over to Foster Care
Worker for transport back to their foster homes.
• MDHHS Worker’s report documenting no findings.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is no evidence to
support the allegations of Foster Care Worker hitting, pinching and
biting Youth A. The version of events reported by Parent A are
inconsistent.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
